name: Holiday Footfall Largely Event-Driven
description: Black Friday weekend delivered solid footfall and transactions, but retailers remain uncertain about the season ahead. Early signals show localized events and in-store experiences produce immediate traffic lifts more reliably than loyalty pushes during heavy discount windows.
operator_move: Operator move: Head of Retail to run a partnered 2-day community event in the next 6-week window, targeting +15% foot_traffic_uplift and QR redemption ≥5% on event days.
operator_scan: Measure net footfall lift, QR redemptions, and ticket-per-visit during event days
spine_hook: Events produce reliable short-term footfall in discount weeks

name: Experience Trumps Points During Rapid Switching
description: When experience falters, members churn fast and points offer weak retention. Low switching costs mean loyalty math collapses unless events or store experiences are meaningfully differentiated.
operator_move: Operator move: Head of CX to A/B test two event experience designs in the next 6-week window, aiming to cut 30-day post-event churn among attendees by 10 percentage points.
operator_scan: Track post-event repeat purchase rate and 30-day membership churn
spine_hook: Experience quality determines loyalty retention in high-promo periods

name: Heavy Discounting Compresses Loyalty Premiums
description: Black Friday–level discounts drive conversions but compress the economic value of loyalty offers and margins. That shifts the ROI calculus toward event-driven acquisition and one-off collabs unless loyalty redemptions are re-priced.
operator_move: Operator move: Head of Finance to run a two-week margin sensitivity model testing scenarios with loyalty redemption up 20% and promo depth up 10%, then publish break-even CPA per channel.
operator_scan: Model margin impact and break-even CPA across promo intensity scenarios
spine_hook: Deep discounts erode the economic advantage of loyalty offers

name: Store-as-Studio Events Multiply Discovery vs Points
description: Brands using stores as content studios for collabs convert in-store audiences into broader reach and earlier purchases. Media-led events lift buyer activity share more than routine loyalty campaigns during short holiday windows.
operator_move: Operator move: Head of Partnerships to run one media-led store-as-studio collab in the next quarter, targeting early_window_share ≥20% and event CPA ≤0.8x baseline.
operator_scan: Measure early-window buyer share and media reach per event dollar
spine_hook: Store-as-studio events amplify discovery and early-window conversions
